Gender gap stands at its widest level since 2016. In 2024, women working full-time year-round made 80.9 cents per dollar earned by men, a significant worsening of the gender earnings ratio compared to 82.7 cents per dollar in 2023.

I think price level is the thing to look at rather than inflation. Americans under the age of about 60 hadn’t experienced a bout of inflation in their economic lives and didn’t realize prices wouldn’t go down. Doesn’t explain the gender gap but I think does explain the economy complaints in ‘24

I think perception trumps reality in a lot of these cases and that plays into longer trends (22 had sharper inflation but the consistent feeling of the cost of living outstripping earning power for two more years makes it worse). The gender gap is also not economic so much as men feel more entitled.

text: There’s a corollary to this - if misogyny is acting as a gateway drug to other forms of extremism, then gender is a tool that can also be used to shed light on those ideologies. There are polls that show a gender gap in racial attitudes that is larger than the gap between white & racialized people.

There are polls from as early as 2019 & 2020 that show men as less likely than white people and women as more likely than NBPOC to believe that white supremacy is an issue. 

It may sound crazy, but IMO, the racial reckoning of 2020 exacerbated the gender gap regarding support for white supremacy.

It’s the law: Men and women must receive equal pay for equal work.

⚖️ Work rated as equivalent
⚖️ Work of equal value
